body_html: Yes, that's what we had for random states in rnn, that's why rnn module now has a dict with rng state per GPU. Broadcasting buffers is ~1.5% of the runtime for resnet with 64/GPU, would be more for smaller batch sizes or future architectures.
body_text: Yes, that's what we had for random states in rnn, that's why rnn module now has a dict with rng state per GPU. Broadcasting buffers is ~1.5% of the runtime for resnet with 64/GPU, would be more for smaller batch sizes or future architectures.
body: Yes, that's what we had for random states in rnn, that's why rnn module now has a dict with rng state per GPU. Broadcasting buffers is ~1.5% of the runtime for resnet with 64/GPU, would be more for smaller batch sizes or future architectures.
